title: 106_hr1006
content: The Act titled "Medicare Psychiatric Hospital Prospective Payment System Act of 1999" establishes a Medicare prospective payment system for psychiatric facilities. The Medicare Psychiatric Hospital Prospective Payment System Act of 1999 establishes a prospective payment system for inpatient psychiatric services under the Social Security Act. This system determines the amount of payment for operating and capital-related costs of psychiatric facilities during a specified transition period. The Medicare Psychiatric Hospital Prospective Payment System Act of 1999 establishes a payment system for inpatient psychiatric services. The system determines payment based on facility-specific per diem rates and applicable Federal per diem rates for each day of services furnished in a cost reporting period. The Act establishes a payment system for psychiatric services based on facility-specific per diem rates and applicable Federal rates for each day of services. Payment for new facilities is determined using the Federal per diem rate. The Secretary determines allowable costs on a per diem basis for each facility's cost reporting period. The Act establishes a payment system for psychiatric services based on facility-specific per diem rates and applicable Federal rates for each day of services. The Secretary determines allowable costs on a per diem basis for each facility's cost reporting period, updating the amount by a market basket percentage increase. The Secretary determines allowable costs on a per diem basis for each psychiatric facility, updating the amount by a market basket percentage increase. The standardized per diem rate is computed by adjusting for variations in average facility wage by area. The Secretary computes weighted average per diem rates for psychiatric facilities based on facility wage levels and case mix variations. Urban and rural areas have separate rates. The Secretary computes separate weighted average per diem rates for psychiatric facilities in urban and rural areas based on facility wage levels and case mix variations. Urban areas have rates for psychiatric hospitals, while rural areas have rates for psychiatric units. The Secretary establishes separate average weighted per diem rates for facilities owned by government agencies and for other facilities. The rates are computed based on the number of days of inpatient hospital services provided. The Secretary computes Federal per diem rates for psychiatric facilities based on weighted average per diem rates, adjusted annually for market basket percentage increase. The Secretary adjusts Federal per diem rates for psychiatric facilities based on variations in facility wage levels, case mix, and proportion of low-income patients served. Additionally, adjustments may be made for outlier cases. The Secretary may adjust for outlier cases, indirect costs of medical education, and other relevant factors. Budget neutrality must be maintained in implementing adjustments to ensure aggregate payments remain consistent. The Secretary is also tasked with establishing classes of patients for psychiatric facilities. The Secretary is responsible for establishing classes of patients in psychiatric facilities based on factors deemed appropriate and assigning weighting factors to reflect resource usage. Data collection and utilization monitoring may be required. The Secretary may require psychiatric facilities to submit necessary data for system implementation. Utilization of inpatient hospital services will be monitored, with reports to Congress and recommendations for legislation. Special adjustments may be made to reduce payment amounts for services furnished by psychiatric facilities. The subsection addresses reducing payments for inpatient hospital services provided by psychiatric facilities in fiscal years 2001 and 2002 to offset payment increases from previous years. The subsection reduces payments for inpatient hospital services provided by psychiatric facilities in fiscal years 2001 and 2002. Definitions for "base fiscal year" and "PPS percentage" are provided. The subsection reduces payments for inpatient hospital services provided by psychiatric facilities in fiscal years 2001 and 2002. The term 'psychiatric facility' includes psychiatric hospitals and units. The 'TEFRA percentage' determines payment reductions for specific cost reporting periods. The Balanced Budget Act of 1997 reduces payments for psychiatric facilities in specific cost reporting periods. The TEFRA percentage determines the extent of payment reductions for different fiscal years. The Balanced Budget Act of 1997 reduces payments for psychiatric facilities, ensuring that the amount of payment for operating costs of inpatient hospital services is not less than 95 percent for certain cost reporting periods. The term 'psychiatric facility' includes psychiatric hospitals and units as defined in the legislation. The amendments made by the Act apply retroactively as if included in the original enactment.
